intro: Pecteilis susannae subsp. henryi, commonly known as the Henry's pecteilis, is a flowering plant native to parts of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
